name: tippy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly US If something is tippy, it is likely to move about so that one side is higher than the other, or to turn over: It was hard to sleep on the tippy wooden benches in the bus station. Her tippy little racing canoe was not designed for such difficult conditions.
More examplesFewer examplesWe had to cross over to other side of the river using a tippy raft.I discovered that my cabin was in the tippiest part of the boat.The earliest skateboard was just a tippy piece of wood bolted onto some wheels.

on tippy toes
(also on your tippy toes) child's expression for
on tiptoe(s) : I had to get on tippy toes to see over the fence. I got on my tippy toes and reached for the bottles.
